result.execSummary:
The defendant Alonzo Mays III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: *Obtain employment and/or participate in vocational training equal to 30 hours per week;

*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alonzo Mays III

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript CONTINUED SENTENCING (19 pages) commencing JANUARY 29, 2016 received and filed.

Defendant Alonzo Mays in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Alonzo Mays in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Parties are prepared to proceed. State placed negotiations on the record. Court finds the State has complied with the victim rights legislation. Statements made as to sentencing. Discussion regarding prior no contact orders. Court ordered this matter adjourned for the parties to complete additional investigation. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

As to COUNT 1-
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 dismissed but read in for purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Alonzo Mays in court with attorney Calvin R Malone.  Defendant Alonzo Mays in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Court finds the State has complied with the victim rights legislation.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 2-
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.
Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Alonzo Mays not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea hearing. Branch 25 in jury trial. No other courts available for a spin. Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report - Discharge Summary - received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Alonzo Mays not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel anticipates a resolution in this matter and requested a projected plea date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Alonzo Mays not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Discussion regarding the defendant's new pending case 15CF3834. Defense counsel recently received a new offer from the State and requested an adjourned scheduling date to review the offer with the defendant. State joined in the request for an adjourned scheduling date. Court granted joint request for adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Alonzo Mays not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard on behalf of Kimberly Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for bail hearing. Discussion regarding Justice Point violation and the defendant's new pending case 15CF3834. Arguments heard as to bail. Court ordered cash bail be set at $5,000.00 with turnover to Justice Point GPS monitoring. Defendant to have NO CONTACT with anyone on the no contact order. Case remains scheduled for plea hearing on 9/09/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Clerk notified by Justice Point that the defendant was charged in another case. Court ordered this case be set for a bail hearing. Parties notified via email. Case adjourned to 8/31/15 at 8:30 a.m. for Bail/Bond Hearing in Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Alonzo Mays in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the State. Parties anticipate a resolution in this matter. Defense counsel requested a projected plea date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 08-13-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alonzo Mays in court with Attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Thomas Potter, appearing for Kimberly Dorice Schoepp, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.
All parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 case will be reassigned to Branch 25, Judge Stephanie Rothstein, in Room G55A of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Clerk:  jms

JusticePoint Pretrial Report dated July 13, 2015 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jamie S., Jessie S. and Barbara O.

Defendant Alonzo Mays in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Alonzo Mays in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. The court enters a plea of not guilty as to Count 1 on behalf of the defendant. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Alonzo Mays III
Current: 3225 S. 84th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53227   (Effective: 06-29-2015)
Prior: 2327 West Howard Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53221
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
